intro: Thesium libanoticum, commonly known as the Jordanian thesium, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Xanthorrhoeaceae. It is a perennial herb characterized by its slender, branching stems and small, grass-like leaves. The plant produces clusters of pale yellow or greenish-white flowers, which are typically borne in dense inflorescences. It is native to arid and semi-arid regions of the Middle East, particularly in Jordan and Saudi Arabia. Thesium libanoticum is adapted to thrive in harsh, dry environments, often found in rocky soils and along coastal areas.
